Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 200 of 262 1911
LC8Cmax7 Rodgers - cross
1 (Jury present)
2 THE COURT: Everyone may be seated. Thank you, members of the jury.
3 Mr. Everdell, you may continue with your cross examination.
4 MR. RODGERS: I remind you, you are under oath. You may inquire.
5 MR. EVERDELL: Thank you, your Honor.
6 BY MR. EVERDELL:
7 Q. Welcome back, Mr. Rodgers.
8 A. Thank you.
9 Q. You were asked a lot of questions by the government on direct examination about a woman that we are referring to as Jane. Do you recall that?
10 A. Yes.
11 Q. To be clear, Jane is not her real name, her real first name; correct?
12 A. Correct.
13 Q. But you do know what her name is, her real name?
14 THE COURT: Without saying it.
15 Q. Without saying it?
16 A. Yes.
17 Q. Now, you say you recall seeing Jane on Epstein's plane; right?
18 A. Yes.
19 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

text_blocks.content:
(Jury present)
THE COURT: Everyone may be seated. Thank you, members of the jury.
Mr. Everdell, you may continue with your cross examination.
MR. RODGERS: I remind you, you are under oath. You may inquire.
MR. EVERDELL: Thank you, your Honor.
BY MR. EVERDELL:
Q. Welcome back, Mr. Rodgers.
A. Thank you.
Q. You were asked a lot of questions by the government on direct examination about a woman that we are referring to as Jane. Do you recall that?
A. Yes.
Q. To be clear, Jane is not her real name, her real first name; correct?
A. Correct.
Q. But you do know what her name is, her real name?
THE COURT: Without saying it.
Q. Without saying it?
A. Yes.
Q. Now, you say you recall seeing Jane on Epstein's plane; right?
A. Yes.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and legible format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
